keywords: international society on thrombosis and haemostasis
en.purpose: To calculate and interpret the total score of the ISTH-SCC bleeding assessment tool.
en.use:
This tool assesses the presence and severity of bleeding symptoms and can serve as a screening tool to determine which patients require additional laboratory evaluation.

It has been validated in various inherited bleeding disorder populations, including von Willebrand disease, hemophilia, and platelet disorders.

Results may inform the need for further diagnostic workup in patients with a suspected inherited bleeding disorder.
- Low scores are associated with a low likelihood of a bleeding disorder, and additional evaluation may not be warranted.
- Elevated scores indicate an increased risk of bleeding; further evaluation for an underlying inherited bleeding disorder is appropriate (e.g., laboratory studies, specialty consultation).
en.misuse:
The tool has been validated for use in adults and children, although sensitivity is lower in pediatric populations.

It has low sensitivity for acquired bleeding disorders.

For the calculation, only symptoms and treatment BEFORE and AT diagnosis should be considered.

Results are not intended to be diagnostic but should be used as part of a comprehensive evaluation in conjunction with clinical judgment and specialty consultation.
